Cosmoteer path not set, please set it in: Cosmoteer path not set, please set it in the settings for Cosmoteer Rules Configuration. This is required for the language server to work correctly.
References in function calls need to be: References in function calls need to be parenthesized or math expressions
References can be in the following forma: References can be in the following formats: <>, .., ~, /, ^, &<>, &.., &~, &/, &A-Z
You either reference a non-existing iden: You either reference a non-existing identifier or a identifier that is not in scope
Between two expressions should be a Valu: Between two expressions should be a Value
Last element in MathExpression should be: Last element in MathExpression should be a Value
Invalid argument type, expected Number o: Invalid argument type, expected Number or Reference. Got {0}
Reference in function calls need to star: Reference in function calls need to start with an ampersand
Reference in function calls need to be p: Reference in function calls need to be parenthesized
Invalid argument type, expected Referenc: Invalid argument type, expected Reference(&) or Number. Got {0}
Expected right brace but found end of fi: Expected right brace but found end of file
Expected right brace to close the object: Expected right brace to close the object
Not expected right brace, did you mean t: Not expected right brace, did you mean to open an object?
Expected right bracket but found end of: Expected right bracket but found end of file
Expected right bracket to close the arra: Expected right bracket to close the array
Not expected bracket, did you mean to op: Not expected bracket, did you mean to open an array?
Expected value, expression or function c: Expected value, expression or function call
Values can be a number or a reference, e: Values can be a number or a reference, expressions can be +, -, *, /
Expected value or expression in math exp: Expected value or expression in math expression
If you want to assign a value to an iden: If you want to assign a value to an identifier, you need to provide a value after the equals sign
If you don't want to assign a value to a: If you don't want to assign a value to an identifier, you need to remove the equals sign
Those Values should be a References: Those Values should be a References
Expected reference value after reference: Expected reference value after reference value but found {0}
String delimiters are only allowed after: String delimiters are only allowed after a String
This could be a bug in the parser or lex: This could be a bug in the parser or lexer, please report this issue, if you think this is a bug
